content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
I need to scan three GitHub repositories to find new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a PopeBot skill. Let me start by exploring these repositories.

First, let me check what's already in the current environment to understand the structure better, then I'll clone and explore the three repositories.

Let me start by:
1. Checking the current skills directory structure
2. Cloning the three repositories to explore them
3. Finding the best new idea
4. Implementing it as a skill
5. Testing it
6. Sending an email report

Let me begin.

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories, identify the best new idea, implement it as a PopeBot skill, test it, and send you a detailed progress report. Let me start by exploring each repository.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20
mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20
mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot.git thepopebot 2>&1 | head -20

</parameter>
</function>
